Heart Failure Inpatient Analysis

Harrison Nguyen and Charmaine Tam

10/11/2021

Source: vignettes/inpatient_analysis.Rmd
inpatient_analysis.Rmd
library(magrittr)
library(targets)
library(tidyverse)

library(ggplot2)
library(ggpubr)
library(acs)
library(flextable)

library(hefd)

source('R/plot_utils.R')
encounter_ref <- load_data("encounter_reference")
encounter <- load_data("encounter")
diagnosis <- load_data("diagnosis")
diagnosis_history <- load_data("diagnosis_history")
problem <- load_data("problem")
orders <- load_data("orders")
patient <- load_data("patient")
query <- glue::glue("SELECT * from MEDICATION_ORDERS as x \\
            WHERE ENCNTR_ID in (SELECT PX9_ENCNTR_ID from ENCOUNTER_REFERENCE \\
             WHERE Q4_DIAGNOSIS = 1 and PROCESS_FLAG = 1 and HISTORY_FLAG = 0) and (ORIG_ORD_AS_FLAG = 1 OR ORIG_ORD_AS_FLAG=2)")
medication_order <- execute_query(query)

hf_form <- execute_query("SELECT * from DCP_FORMS_ACTIVITY where DESCRIPTION = 'Heart Failure (MACARF) Referral Form' or DESCRIPTION = 'Heart Failure - Management of Cardiac Function Enrolment'")
location_string <- "Royal North Shore"
hf_diag <- diagnosis %>%
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER,"(?i)I50") & DIAG_TYPE_CD == "Final")

qual_enc <- encounter %>%
  dplyr::filter(DISCH_DT_TM <= as.Date("2021-7-31") & DISCH_DT_TM >= as.Date("2019-1-1")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(ENCNTR_ID %in% hf_diag$ENCNTR_ID & LOC_FACILITY_CD == location_string)

cohort <- qual_enc %>%
  dplyr::distinct(PERSON_ID)

time_period <- round(difftime(max(qual_enc$DISCH_DT_TM,na.rm = TRUE), min(qual_enc$DISCH_DT_TM,na.rm = TRUE),units="days")/362.2425,1)

Introduction

This document will investigate encounters that have been coded with a heart failure-related ICD10 code (I50; primary or secondary) at Royal North Shore Hospital with discharge dates between 2019-01-01 to 2021-07-30. Thus, in a 2.6 year period, there are 3534 encounters with unique 2652 patients. Figure @ref(fig:dist-enc-plot) shows the distribution of the number of encounters for each patient and Figure @ref(fig:encntr-type-plot) shows the distribution of encounters type where the majority of encounters are inpatient encounters.

The analysis of this cohort will be used to examine:

  1. Demographics and characteristics
  • Total admissions by facility
  • Age and sex distributions
  • Numbers of patient journeys and transfers across the District
  • Mode of admission and mode of separation
  • Number of patients with Advanced Care Directive
  • Previous hospitalisation in the past 3 years (for HF or other?, primary or additional diagnoses?)
  1. Investigations
  • Number of patients with at least 1 echocardiogram performed
  • BNP and Iron profiles
  1. Discharge management
  • Number of patients with discharge letters
  • Number of patients on relevant discharge medications or none
  • Number of patients that are referred to the HF service

This feasibility analyses will be initially be performed for encounters at RNSH, then Ryde and Hornsby, and then patients that transfer between NSLHD facilities.

counts <- qual_enc %>%
  dplyr::group_by(PERSON_ID) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n())

proportion_bar_plot(counts,"N", "Number of encounters per patient",n_suffix="patients") + xlab("")

Distribution of the number of encounters for each patient. 

proportion_bar_plot(qual_enc,"ENCNTR_TYPE_CD","Distribution of Encounter Type",n_suffix = "encounters") + xlab("")

Distribution of Encounter Type. 

extract_hf_diagnosis <- function(df,group_cols = "ENCNTR_ID",split_priority = FALSE){
  
  group_cols <- rlang::sym(group_cols)
  
  if(!split_priority){
     df %<>%
      dplyr::group_by(!!group_cols) %>%
      dplyr::summarise(
        `Congestive heart failure` = any(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.0" | SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50"),
        `Heart failure, unspecified` = any(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.9"),
        `Left ventricular failure` = any(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.1")
      ) %>%
      replace(is.na(.), FALSE)
  }
  else{
     df %<>%
      dplyr::group_by(!!group_cols) %>%
      dplyr::summarise(
        `Primary Congestive heart failure` = any((SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.0" | SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50") & DIAG_PRIORITY == 1),
        `Primary Heart failure, unspecified` = any(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.9" & DIAG_PRIORITY == 1),
        `Primary Left ventricular failure` = any(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.1" & DIAG_PRIORITY == 1),
        `Secondary Congestive heart failure` = any((SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.0" | SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50") 
                                                 & DIAG_PRIORITY != 1),
        `Secondary Heart failure, unspecified` = any(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.9" & DIAG_PRIORITY != 1),
        `Secondary Left ventricular failure` = any(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER == "I50.1" & DIAG_PRIORITY != 1)
      ) %>%
      replace(is.na(.), FALSE)
  }
 
  
  return(df)
}

Cohort Stratification - Primary & Secondary Heart Failure Diagnosis

hf_diag_primary <- hf_diag %>%
  dplyr::filter(DIAG_PRIORITY == 1 & ENCNTR_ID %in% qual_enc$ENCNTR_ID)
  
hf_diag_secondary <- hf_diag %>%
  dplyr::filter(DIAG_PRIORITY != 1 & ENCNTR_ID %in% qual_enc$ENCNTR_ID)
primary_temp <- hf_diag_primary %>%
  extract_hf_diagnosis() %>%
  dplyr::mutate(`Primary HF Diagnosis` = TRUE)

secondary_temp <- hf_diag_secondary %>%
  extract_hf_diagnosis() %>%
  dplyr::mutate(`Secondary HF Diagnosis` = TRUE)

combined_temp <- hf_diag %>%
  dplyr::filter(ENCNTR_ID %in% qual_enc$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  extract_hf_diagnosis() %>%
  dplyr::mutate(`Prim. & Sec. HF Diagnosis` = TRUE)
hf_diag_primary_count <- hf_diag_primary %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n()) %>%
  dplyr::filter(N > 1)

hf_diag_secondary_count <- hf_diag_secondary %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n()) %>%
  dplyr::filter(N > 1)

Figure @ref(fig:icd10-dist-plot) shows the distribution of primary and secondary heart failure ICD10 codes. In some cases, there are encounters with multiple heart failure primary diagnoses, (n = 59) and similarly with secondary diagnosis (n = 233).

diag_count <- sort(colSums(combined_temp) )

For the given diagnosis, congestive heart failure is most prevalent, followed by left ventricular failure then heart failure, unspecified.

p1 <- plot_logical_columns(primary_temp,"ICD10","Primary HF ICD10",n_suffix="encounters") + 
  scale_x_discrete(guide = guide_axis(n.dodge=2)) + 
  ggplot2::ylim(0,nrow(primary_temp)*1.5)

p2 <- plot_logical_columns(secondary_temp,"ICD10","Secondary HF ICD10",n_suffix="encounters") + 
  scale_x_discrete(guide = guide_axis(n.dodge=2))+ 
  ggplot2::ylim(0,nrow(secondary_temp)*1.5)

p3 <- plot_logical_columns(combined_temp,"ICD10","Combined Primary & Secondary HF ICD10",n_suffix="encounters") + 
  scale_x_discrete(guide = guide_axis(n.dodge=2))+ 
  ggplot2::ylim(0,nrow(combined_temp)*1.5)

ggpubr::ggarrange(p1,p2,p3,labels= c("A","B","C"), ncol = 1, nrow = 3)

Distribution of primary and secondary ICD10 diagnosis. 

prim_sec_merge <- primary_temp %>%
  dplyr::inner_join(secondary_temp,by="ENCNTR_ID",suffix = c("_PRIMARY","_SECONDARY")) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(PRIMARY_DIAG = 
                  dplyr::case_when(
                    `Congestive heart failure_PRIMARY` ~ "Congestive heart failure",
                    `Left ventricular failure_PRIMARY` ~ "Left ventricular failure",
                    `Heart failure, unspecified_PRIMARY` ~ "Heart failure, unspecified",
                  ),
                SECONDARY_DIAG = 
                  dplyr::case_when(
                    `Congestive heart failure_SECONDARY` ~ "Congestive heart failure",
                    `Left ventricular failure_SECONDARY` ~ "Left ventricular failure",
                    `Heart failure, unspecified_SECONDARY` ~ "Heart failure, unspecified",
                  )
                )
diag_tab <- prop.table(table(prim_sec_merge$PRIMARY_DIAG,prim_sec_merge$SECONDARY_DIAG))

An encounter can also be associated with both a primary and secondary heart failure ICD10, where 2.3% (82/3534) of encounters have both a primary and secondary heart failure ICD10 diagnosis . Table @ref(tab:primary-sec-hf-diag) shows the encounters with both a primary and secondary HF diagnosis (n = 82) and the proportion of this selection with different combinations of primary and secondary diagnosis. For example, 80.5% of these encounters have both a primary and secondary diagnosis of congestive heart failure. This is explained by coding occurring at the episode level and encounters may have >1 episode.

tab_caption <- paste0("Contingency table of Primary and Secondary HF Diagnosis (N = ",
                      nrow(prim_sec_merge),"/",nrow(combined_temp),")")
diag_tab %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = tab_caption,digits=2) %>%
  kableExtra::add_header_above(c("Primary ICD10"=1,"Secondary ICD10"=3))%>%
  kable_styling(position = "center",full_width = FALSE)

only_secondary <- secondary_temp %>%
  dplyr::filter(!ENCNTR_ID %in% primary_temp$ENCNTR_ID)
n_only_prim <-  nrow(only_secondary)

primary_diag_of_secondary <- diagnosis %>%
  dplyr::filter(!stringr::str_detect(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER,"(?i)I50") & 
                  ENCNTR_ID %in% only_secondary$ENCNTR_ID &
                  DIAG_PRIORITY == 1 &
                  SOURCE_VOCABULARY_CD == "ICD10-AM") 

tab_cap <- paste(
  "Top 15 primary diagnosis for those with only a secondary heart failure diagnosis (N =",
  n_only_prim,
  "encounters).",
  sep=" "
)

tab <- primary_diag_of_secondary %>%
  dplyr::group_by(SOURCE_STRING) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n_distinct(ENCNTR_ID)) %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(prop = round(N/dplyr::n_distinct(primary_diag_of_secondary$PERSON_ID)*100,1)) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(N)) %>% 
  dplyr::top_n(15)


tab_names <- tab %>%
  dplyr::filter(!stringr::str_detect(SOURCE_STRING,"(?i)awaiting admission"))

Table @ref(tab:prim-sec-tab) shows the primary diagnosis of those encounters with ONLY secondary heart failure diagnosis (n = 2287). The data shows that these encounters are also commonly associated with pneumonia, unspecified, as well as diagnoses such as atrial fibrillation and atrial flutter, unspecified or a acute subendocardial myocardial infarction.

tab %>%
  knitr::kable(caption = tab_cap)

primary_cohort <- cohort %>%
  dplyr::filter(PERSON_ID %in% hf_diag_primary$PERSON_ID) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_PRIMARY_HF = TRUE)


AGE_breaks <- c(-Inf,18, 25, 45, 65, 80, Inf)
  AGE_labels <- c("<18", "19-24", "25-44", "45-64", "65-80", "80+")
  
primary_enc <- encounter %>%
  dplyr::filter(ENCNTR_ID %in% hf_diag_primary$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(patient, by = "PERSON_ID") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(AGE = as.integer(difftime(ACTIVE_STATUS_DT_TM,BIRTH_DT_TM, units="weeks")/52.25))%>%
  dplyr::mutate(AGE_BINNED = cut(AGE, breaks = AGE_breaks, labels = AGE_labels,
                                   right = FALSE)) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(LOS = difftime(DISCH_DT_TM,ARRIVE_DT_TM,units="days")) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(primary_temp, by="ENCNTR_ID") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(PRIMARY_DIAG = 
                  dplyr::case_when(
                    `Congestive heart failure` ~ "Congestive heart failure",
                    `Left ventricular failure` ~ "Left ventricular failure",
                    `Heart failure, unspecified` ~ "Heart failure, unspecified",
                  ))

The cohort that will be analysed for the rest of this document are those encounters with a primary heart failure diagnosis.

Demographics in patients with encounters containing a primary HF ICD10 code

With these selection and exclusion criteria, the cohort for this analysis will include 1247 number of encounters for 952 unique patients with the following demographics.

primary_demo <- primary_enc %>%
  dplyr::group_by(PERSON_ID) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(AGE) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
  dplyr::ungroup()

total<- bind_rows(primary_demo, mutate(primary_demo, SEX_CD = "Total")) %>%
  group_by(SEX_CD) %>%
  summarise(
    N = n(),
    Age = round(mean(AGE)),
  ) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = "SEX_CD", values_from = c("N", "Age")) %>%
  mutate(p_Female = round(N_Female/N_Total*100, 1),
         p_Male = round(N_Male/N_Total*100, 1)) %>%
  select(
         Females = N_Female, p_Female,
         Males = N_Male, p_Male,
         N_Total,
         Age_Female,
         Age_Male,
         Age_Total) %>%
  flextable() %>%
  set_header_labels(Group = "", p_Female = "%", p_Male = "%", N_Total = "n",
                    Age_Female = "Age (F)", Age_Male = "Age (M)", Age_Total = "Mean Age")
total

admission_mode_count <- primary_enc %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ADMIT_MODE_CD) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n()) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(N)) %>%
  dplyr::filter(ADMIT_MODE_CD != "NDF")

sep_mode_count <- primary_enc %>%
  dplyr::group_by(DISCH_DISPOSITION_CD) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n())%>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(N))%>%
  dplyr::filter(DISCH_DISPOSITION_CD != "NDF")

Figure @ref(fig:admit-disch-mode-plot) shows the distribution of admission and discharges modes for these encounters with a primary HF diagnosis. Arrival by State Ambulance Vehicle is the most prevalent mode of admission followed by Private Car then No Transport (Walked In). On the other hand, the top 3 discharge modes were, Discharge by Hospital, followed by Transfer to Hospital in the area/region then Pt Death without Autopsy.

p1 <- proportion_bar_plot(primary_enc,"ADMIT_MODE_CD","Mode of Admission",n_suffix="encounters",vjust=0.25) + ylim(0,800) +xlab("")  + coord_flip()

Admission and Discharge mode of encounters with primary HF diagnosis.

Figure @ref(fig:los-dis-plot)A shows the distribution of the length of stay (LOS) with a red line marking the median LOS (5.6 days) and Figure @ref(fig:los-dis-plot)B shows the distribution of LOS by diagnosis. Furthermore, Table @ref(tab:los-stat-tab) shows various statistics of the LOS by diagnosis. Encounters with either a missing admission or discharge date have been excluded.

Distribution of Length of Stay 

primary_enc %>%
  dplyr::bind_rows(mutate(primary_enc, PRIMARY_DIAG = "Total")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(LOS)) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(PRIMARY_DIAG) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(MEAN = as.numeric(round(mean(LOS),1)),
                   MAX = as.numeric(round(max(LOS),1)),
                   MIN = as.numeric(round(min(LOS),1)),
                   MEDIAN = as.numeric(round(median(LOS),1)),
                   STD = as.numeric(round(sd(LOS),1)),
                   N = dplyr::n()) %>%
  flextable() %>%
  set_caption("Statistics of LOS by HF diagnosis.")
ferric_carboxy <- execute_query("select * from MEDICATION_ORDERS 
where CATALOG_CD like '%carboxy%'")

ferric_carboxy %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ORDERED_AS_MNEMONIC) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n()) %>%
  flextable() %>%
  autofit() %>%
  set_caption("Ferric carboxymaltose orders in the NSLHD EMR and the total number of counts.")
primary_enc_iv <- primary_enc %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_FERRIC = ENCNTR_ID %in% ferric_carboxy$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(BELOW_MEDIAN_LOS = LOS < median(LOS,na.rm=TRUE))
primary_enc_iv %>%
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(BELOW_MEDIAN_LOS)) %>%
conditional_bar_plot("BELOW_MEDIAN_LOS", "HAS_FERRIC","LOS vs Ferric Carboxymaltose Infusion")

Proportion of encounters with LOS below the median with an ferric carboxymaltose IV infusion.

Table @ref(fig:ferric-count-tab) shows the types of orders and counts of Ferric carboxymaltose IV infusion in the NSLHD EMR.

Figure @ref(tab:ferric-los-plot) shows the proportion of encounters that are either above or below the median LOS that also might have a Ferric carboxymaltose IV infusion. Encounters with either a missing admission or discharge date have been excluded. The plot demonstrates that if the encounter is NOT below the median LOS, they are more likely to have a Ferric carboxymaltose IV infusion and are less likely to have an infusion if the LOS is below the median.

Comparison with CaseMix App

The above numbers were compared against the in-house Admitted Patient CaseMix app developed by the NSLHD Performance and Analytics team that shows the numbers of encounters and their characteristics of each ICD10 diagnosis.

Figure @ref(fig:clinical-app-demo) shows that there are a similar number of encounters with a primary heart failure ICD10 diagnosis over a the same period of time at Royal North Shore. Furthermore the distribution of ICD10 codes are comparable between the current cohort and the NSLHD Performance and Analytics team.

# All defaults
file <-paste0("vignettes/img/inpatient_hf_casemix_",tolower(stringr::str_replace_all(location_string," ","_")),".PNG")
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(here::here(),file))

Distribution of ICD10 heart failure encounters using the `Admitted Patient CaseMix App.

Advanced Care Directive

The Advanced Care Directive is represented in the EMR as an alert with the string Known to Heart Failure Support Services.

known_to_hf <- problem %>%
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(SOURCE_STRING,"(?i)Known to heart failure")) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(PERSON_ID) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(BEG_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
  dplyr::select(PERSON_ID,BEG_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_ALERT = TRUE)

kk<- primary_cohort %>%
  merge(.,select(known_to_hf,-BEG_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM) , by="PERSON_ID",all=TRUE) %>%
  replace(is.na(.), FALSE)

prop_tab <- prop.table(table(kk$HAS_PRIMARY_HF,kk$HAS_ALERT))
tab <- table(kk$HAS_PRIMARY_HF,kk$HAS_ALERT)
tab  %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "Contigency table of Primary HF ICD10 and Advanced Care directive (ACD).",digits=2) %>%
  kableExtra::add_header_above(c("Has Primary\n ICD10"=1,"Has ACD"=2))%>%
  kable_styling(position = "center",full_width = FALSE)
Contigency table of Primary HF ICD10 and Advanced Care directive (ACD).
Has Primary
ICD10
Has ACD
FALSE TRUE
FALSE 0 1152
TRUE 485 467

Table @ref(tab:acd-tab) shows a contingency table of the number of patients with a primary ICD10 code who also have an Advanced Care Directive. The right-most column shows number of patients with a ACD across NSLHD (n = 1619) and the bottom-most row shows the number of people with a primary HF diagnosis (n = 952). The combination of the rows and columns show the number of people who have either a ACD or diagnosis, or both or none.

For example, there are 467 patients with both a ACD AND a primary heart failure diagnosis. Thus there are 49.1% of patients (467/485 + 467) with a primary HF ICD10 that have an advanced care directive.

primary_enc_alert <- primary_enc %>%
  dplyr::left_join(known_to_hf,by="PERSON_ID") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(ALERT_DELTA = difftime(BEG_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM,ARRIVE_DT_TM,units="days")) %>%
  tidyr::replace_na(list(HAS_ALERT=FALSE))

plot_histogram(
  primary_enc_alert %>%
    dplyr::filter(!is.na(ALERT_DELTA)),
  "ALERT_DELTA","Time taken for ACD to be registered since arrival",
  median(primary_enc_alert$ALERT_DELTA,na.rm=TRUE),n_suffix = "encounters") + xlim(-200,200) + xlab("Time (days)")

Distribution of time taken to register Advanced Care Directive since admission for the encounter. 

n_1_alert <- primary_enc_alert %>%
  dplyr::filter(ALERT_DELTA < 1) %>%
  nrow()

n_3_alert <- primary_enc_alert %>%
  dplyr::filter(ALERT_DELTA < 3) %>%
  nrow()

n_alert <- primary_enc_alert %>%
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(HAS_ALERT)) %>%
  nrow()

median <- as.numeric(median(primary_enc_alert$ALERT_DELTA,na.rm=TRUE))

Figure @ref(fig:alert-delta-plot) shows the distribution of the time taken for the ACD to be registered in the EMR since admission with the median of 2.3 days being marked by the red dashed line. Time differences that are less than 0 means that the ACD was already present when that person was admitted. The data shows that 18% of alerts are registered within 1 day of admission and 30.3% within 3 days of admission.

primary_alert_before_during_enc <- primary_enc_alert %>%
  dplyr::filter(DEPART_DT_TM >= BEG_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM | ALERT_DELTA <= 0)
# ALERT_DELTA <= 0  | ACTIVE_STATUS_DT_TM <=  BEG_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM &  
primary_enc_no_deaths<-primary_enc_alert %>%
  dplyr::filter(DISCH_DISPOSITION_CD != "Pt Death without Autopsy") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_ALERT = ENCNTR_ID %in% primary_alert_before_during_enc$ENCNTR_ID)
  
 

primary_enc_no_deaths %>%
  ggpubr::ggboxplot(x = "HAS_ALERT", y = "AGE", 
          color = "HAS_ALERT", palette = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800"),
          ylab = "AGE", xlab = "HAS_ALERT",title=paste0("Age vs ACD (N = ",nrow(primary_enc_no_deaths)," encounters)"))

Boxplot of Age and whether the encounter has had a ACD or not. Encounters that resulted in patient being deceased are excluded. 

mean <- primary_enc_no_deaths %>% 
    dplyr::group_by(HAS_ALERT) %>% 
    dplyr::summarise(mean = mean(AGE))

Figure @ref(fig:alert-by-age-plot) shows a boxplot of AGE against whether the patient has had an ACD or not (HAS_ALERT). The presence of an ACD is determined as by whether the ACD was registered before the beginning of the admission or during the admission. The plot suggests that the means the AGE of the group with an ACD is higher compared to the group without an ACD (82.1 vs 81.4, respectively). Furthermore the group without an ACD has larger variance w.r.t AGE.

Figure @ref(fig:age-alert-plot) shows the conditional distribution of the cohortâ€™s age and the likelihood that they will have an ACD. The plot suggests that older members are more likely to have an alert and less likely to have an alert if the patient is in the younger age groups, 19-24,25-44 and 45-64.

conditional_bar_plot(primary_enc_no_deaths,"AGE_BINNED","HAS_ALERT","Age vs Alert",n_suffix = "encounters")

Likelihood of having an ACD given the patientâ€™s age. 

res.aov <- aov(AGE ~ HAS_ALERT, data = primary_enc_no_deaths)
summary_results <- summary(res.aov)[[1]]
summary_results %>%
  round(2) %>%
  flextable() %>%
  autofit() %>%
  set_caption("One-way ANOVA test of age against having a ACD or not.")

Table @ref(tab:age-alert-anova-tab) shows the results of a one-way ANOVA with the null hypothesis being that there is no difference in the means of ages between the group that has an ACD to one that does not have an ACD. With a p value of 0.323, the test suggests that there is no statistically significant difference between the two groups to reject the null.

Historical Diagnosis

A historical diagnosis for a patient is defined as a HF ICD10 diagnosis (either primary or secondary) that was coded within the last three years of the patientâ€™s first HF diagnosis between 2019 to 2021. For example, if a patient had been diagnosed with HF in 2018 and 2020, that patient would have been considered to have a historical HF diagnosis if they were diagnosed between 2015 and their encounter in 2018.

Figure @ref(fig:his-diag-plot) shows whether or not a patient has has a historical diagnosis of HF and if so, the coded HF diagnosis. The plot demonstrates that most patients have had no previous HF diagnosis since entering the cohort.

his_hf_diag <- diagnosis_history %>%
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER,"(?i)I50") &
                  PERSON_ID %in% primary_cohort$PERSON_ID)

summary_his_diag <- his_hf_diag %>%
  extract_hf_diagnosis(group_cols = "PERSON_ID",split_priority = TRUE) %>%
  dplyr::right_join(primary_cohort,by="PERSON_ID") %>%
  dplyr::select(-HAS_PRIMARY_HF) %>%
  replace(is.na(.),FALSE) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(`No His. HF ICD10` = !`Primary Congestive heart failure` & !`Primary Heart failure, unspecified`
                  & !`Primary Left ventricular failure` & !`Secondary Congestive heart failure` & 
                    !`Secondary Heart failure, unspecified`
                  & !`Secondary Left ventricular failure`)
plot_logical_columns(summary_his_diag,"ICD10","Distribution of Historical ICD10",n_suffix="patients") +coord_flip()

Distribution of historical diagnosis.

Orders

echos <- orders %>%
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(CATALOG_CD,"(?i)cardio - echo") & ENCNTR_ID %in% primary_enc$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(STATUS_DT_TM)) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
  dplyr::select(ENCNTR_ID,PERSON_ID,CATALOG_CD,STATUS_DT_TM) %>%
  dplyr::right_join(
    dplyr::select(primary_enc,ENCNTR_ID,ARRIVE_DT_TM),by="ENCNTR_ID") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_ECHO = !is.na(CATALOG_CD),ECHO_DELTA = difftime(STATUS_DT_TM,ARRIVE_DT_TM,units = "days")) %>%
  dplyr::ungroup() %>%
  dplyr::select(-CATALOG_CD) %>%
  dplyr::rename(ECHO_START_DT_TM = STATUS_DT_TM)
extract_path_result <- function(df,regex,prefix,breaks=NULL,labels=NULL){
  df %<>% dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(EVENT_CD,regex)) %>%
  dplyr::select(ENCNTR_ID,PERSON_ID,EVENT_START_DT_TM,RESULT_VAL,RESULT_UNITS_CD) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(RESULT_VAL = as.numeric(stringr::str_remove_all(RESULT_VAL, '\"')) )  %>% 
  dplyr::rename("{prefix}_EVENT_START_DT_TM" := EVENT_START_DT_TM,
                
                "{prefix}_RESULT_UNITS_CD" := RESULT_UNITS_CD)
  
  if(!is.null(breaks)){
    df %<>% dplyr::mutate("{prefix}_BIN" := cut(RESULT_VAL,breaks=breaks,labels=labels))
  }
  df %<>% dplyr::rename("{prefix}_RESULT_VAL" := RESULT_VAL)
  
  return(df)
}
path_tests_full <- execute_query("SELECT * from PATHOLOGY_EVENT where CATALOG_CD = 'Brain Natriuretic Peptide' or CATALOG_CD = 'Iron Level' or CATALOG_CD = 'Iron Studies' or CATALOG_CD = 'N Terminal Pro Brain Natriuretic Peptide'")

path_tests  <-  path_tests_full %>%
  dplyr::filter(ENCNTR_ID %in% primary_enc$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(EVENT_CD = dplyr::case_when(
    stringr::str_detect(EVENT_CD,"(Brain Natriuretic peptide)|(N Terminal pro BNP)|(NT-ProBNP)") ~ "BNP",
    TRUE ~ EVENT_CD
  )) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ENCNTR_ID,EVENT_CD) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(EVENT_START_DT_TM)) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
  dplyr::ungroup()
path_tests_full %>%
  dplyr::group_by(EVENT_CD) %>%
  dplyr::filter(ENCNTR_ID %in% primary_enc$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(N = dplyr::n()) %>%
  flextable() %>%
  autofit() %>%
  set_caption("List of strings related to iron and BNP and their counts.")
bnp <- extract_path_result(path_tests,"BNP", "BNP", c(-Inf,450,900,Inf),c("< 450","450-900","900+"))
iron <- extract_path_result(path_tests,"Iron", "IRON",c(-Inf,9,30.4,Inf),c("< 9","9-30.4","30.4+")) 
trans_sat <- extract_path_result(path_tests,"Transferrin Saturation", "TRANSFERRIN_SAT",c(-Inf,20,Inf),c("< 20","20+"))

hf_order<-echos  %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    bnp, by="ENCNTR_ID"
  ) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    iron, by="ENCNTR_ID"
  ) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    trans_sat, by="ENCNTR_ID"
  ) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_BNP = !is.na(BNP_EVENT_START_DT_TM),
                HAS_IRON = !is.na(IRON_EVENT_START_DT_TM),
                HAS_TRANSFERRIN_SAT = !is.na(TRANSFERRIN_SAT_EVENT_START_DT_TM))




order_year_join <- function(cohort,df,time_col){
  time_col <- rlang::sym(time_col)
  cohort %<>%
    dplyr::select(PERSON_ID,ARRIVE_DT_TM,ENCNTR_ID) %>%
    dplyr::left_join(df,by="PERSON_ID",suffix=c("","_ORDER")) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(DELTA = difftime(!!time_col,ARRIVE_DT_TM,units="days")) %>%
    dplyr::filter((DELTA >= -365.25 & DELTA <= 0) | ENCNTR_ID == ENCNTR_ID_ORDER)
    
  return(cohort)
}
cardio_echo_orders <- orders %>%
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(CATALOG_CD,"(?i)cardio - echo"))


echo_year <-  primary_enc %>%
  order_year_join(cardio_echo_orders,"STATUS_DT_TM")




bnp_year <- primary_enc %>%
  order_year_join(bnp,"BNP_EVENT_START_DT_TM")
iron_year <- primary_enc %>%
  order_year_join(iron,"IRON_EVENT_START_DT_TM")
transferrin_sat_year <- primary_enc %>%
  order_year_join(trans_sat,"TRANSFERRIN_SAT_EVENT_START_DT_TM")

primary_orders_in_year<-hf_order %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_ECHO_YEAR = ENCNTR_ID %in% echo_year$ENCNTR_ID,
                HAS_BNP_YEAR = ENCNTR_ID %in% bnp_year$ENCNTR_ID,
                HAS_IRON_YEAR = ENCNTR_ID %in% iron_year$ENCNTR_ID,
                HAS_TRANSFERRIN_SAT_YEAR = ENCNTR_ID %in% transferrin_sat_year$ENCNTR_ID)

Figure @ref(fig:order-year-plot)A shows the proportion of encounters with a relevant heart failure order being echocardiogram, brain natriuretic peptide test, serum iron test and transferrin saturation test of encounters with an order during the encounter. On the other hand, Figure @ref(fig:order-year-plot)B shows the proportion of encounters with an order during the encounter OR within one last year of the beginning of the encounterâ€™s admission. These proportions in Figure @ref(fig:order-year-plot)B for all of these orders is slightly higher compared to Figure @ref(fig:order-year-plot)A.

  dplyr::select(contains("_YEAR")) %>%
  plot_logical_columns("ORDERS","Encounters with Order within 1 Year",n_suffix="encounters",vjust=0) + coord_flip() + xlab("")

Number and proportion of encounters with a relevant heart failure order, echocardiogram, brain natriuretic peptide test, serum iron test and transferrin saturation test during the encounter or within 1 year of the encounter.

Forms

extract_form <- function(df,string,prefix){
  df %<>%
  dplyr::filter(DESCRIPTION == string) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_FORM = TRUE) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(PERSON_ID) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(FORM_DT_TM)) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
  dplyr::select(PERSON_ID,ENCNTR_ID,HAS_FORM,PARENT_ENTITY_ID,FORM_DT_TM) %>%
    dplyr::rename_with(.fn = ~ paste0(prefix,"_",.x))
  
  return(df)
}
form_primary_cohort <- primary_cohort %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    extract_form(hf_form,'Heart Failure - Management of Cardiac Function Enrolment',"ENROLMENT"), by = c("PERSON_ID" = "ENROLMENT_PERSON_ID")
  ) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    extract_form(hf_form,'Heart Failure (MACARF) Referral Form',"REFERRAL"), by = c("PERSON_ID" = "REFERRAL_PERSON_ID")
  ) %>%
  tidyr::replace_na(list(ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM = FALSE, REFERRAL_HAS_FORM = FALSE)) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(NO_FORM = !ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM & !REFERRAL_HAS_FORM)

form_primary_cohort %>%
  dplyr::select(-HAS_PRIMARY_HF) %>%
  plot_logical_columns("Form","Proportion with HF Form",n_suffix="patients") +
 labs(x="")

Proportion of Patients with an enrolment or referral form.

Figure @ref(fig:form-plot) shows the proportion of patients who have had a referral form or enrolment form completed in the EMR.

Figure @ref(fig:no-form-disch-plot) shows the discharge modes for patients without either a referral nor an enrolment form (n = 415).

form_primary_cohort %>%
  dplyr::filter(NO_FORM) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(primary_enc,by="PERSON_ID") %>%
  dplyr::group_by(PERSON_ID) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(
    DISCH_MODE = dplyr::case_when(
      any(DISCH_DISPOSITION_CD == 'Pt Death without Autopsy') ~ 'Death without Autopsy',
      any(DISCH_DISPOSITION_CD == 'Discharge Own Risk') ~ 'Discharge Own Risk',
      any(stringr::str_detect(DISCH_DISPOSITION_CD, "(?i)transfer")) ~ 'Transfer',
      any(DISCH_DISPOSITION_CD == "Discharge by Hospital") ~ "Discharge by Hospital",
    )
  ) %>%
  proportion_bar_plot("DISCH_MODE","Discharge mode for patients without forms",n_suffix="patients") + xlab("")

Distribution of mode of discharge for patients without either a referral nor enrolment form. 

convert_year_half_period <- function(df,date_col){
  date_col <- rlang::sym(date_col)
  df %<>% 
    dplyr::mutate(YEAR_HALF = as.character(zoo::as.yearqtr(!!date_col)),
                HAS_FORM=TRUE) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(YEAR_HALF = stringr::str_replace(YEAR_HALF,"Q(1|2)","P1"),
                YEAR_HALF = stringr::str_replace(YEAR_HALF,"Q(3|4)","P2"))
  
  return(df)
  
}

extract_form_with_year_period <- function(df,string,prefix){
  df %<>% dplyr::filter(DESCRIPTION == string) %>%
    convert_year_half_period("FORM_DT_TM") %>%
  dplyr::select(PERSON_ID,ENCNTR_ID,PARENT_ENTITY_ID,FORM_DT_TM,YEAR_HALF,HAS_FORM) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(PERSON_ID,YEAR_HALF) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(FORM_DT_TM)) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
    dplyr::rename_with(.fn = ~ paste0(prefix,"_",.x))
  
  return(df)
}

Figure @ref(fig:form-by-month-plot) shows the proportion of encounters with either an enrolment, referral form or neither by periods of 6 months where P1 represents Jan-Jun and P2 represents Jul-Dec. Figure @ref(fig:form-by-month-plot) shows that the proportion with enrolment forms is increasing over the 2.6 year period and that particularly in 2021 P1 an increasing percentage of referrals also have an enrolment form.

enrolment_form <- hf_form %>%
  extract_form_with_year_period('Heart Failure - Management of Cardiac Function Enrolment',"ENROLMENT")


referral_form <- hf_form %>%
   extract_form_with_year_period('Heart Failure (MACARF) Referral Form',"REFERRAL")
  
 

temp <- primary_enc %>%
   convert_year_half_period("DISCH_DT_TM")%>%
  dplyr::left_join(enrolment_form,by=c("PERSON_ID" = "ENROLMENT_PERSON_ID",
                                       "YEAR_HALF" = "ENROLMENT_YEAR_HALF")) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(referral_form,by=c("PERSON_ID"= "REFERRAL_PERSON_ID",
                                       "YEAR_HALF" = "REFERRAL_YEAR_HALF")) %>%
   tidyr::replace_na(list(ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM = FALSE, REFERRAL_HAS_FORM = FALSE)) %>%
  
  dplyr::mutate(FORM_STATUS = 
                  dplyr::case_when(
                    !ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM & !REFERRAL_HAS_FORM ~ "No form",
                    REFERRAL_HAS_FORM &  !ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM ~ "Only Referral",
                    !REFERRAL_HAS_FORM &  ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM ~ "Only Enrolment",
                    REFERRAL_HAS_FORM &  ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM ~ "Referral & Enrolment"
                  ))

 temp %>%
   dplyr::filter(YEAR_HALF != "2021 P2") %>%
conditional_bar_plot("YEAR_HALF","FORM_STATUS","Forms by Half Year") + xlab("") + ylim(0,175)

Proportion of encounters with a form by half year periods. 

meds_check <- c(89868202,  90719503,  86980447,  91928857,  87238779,  96890479, 100223311,  98557904,  93399667,  92646432,  93966085,  98134033,

disch_meds_query <- paste0("select * from ENCOUNTER as x
left join MEDICATION_HOME_ORDERS as y
on x.PERSON_ID = y.PERSON_ID  and y.CURRENT_START_DT_TM <= x.DISCH_DT_TM and
(ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Completed' and STATUS_DT_TM > x.DISCH_DT_TM or 
    ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Ordered' or
    ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Discontinued' and DISCONTINUE_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM > x.DISCH_DT_TM or 
    ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Deleted' and STATUS_DT_TM > x.DISCH_DT_TM)
 LEFT JOIN MEDICATION_LIST as z
    
  on CATALOG_CD = MEDICATION_NAME
  left join MEDICATION_GROUP as q
    on z.MEDICATION_GROUP_ID = q.MEDICATION_GROUP_ID
where x.ENCNTR_ID in (",paste(primary_enc$ENCNTR_ID,collapse=","),") and q.MEDICATION_GROUP is not NULL;")

discharge_meds <- execute_query(disch_meds_query)

prescribed_meds_query <- paste0("select * from ENCOUNTER as x
  left join MEDICATION_ORDERS as y
  on x.ENCNTR_ID = y.ENCNTR_ID and
(ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Completed' and STATUS_DT_TM > x.DISCH_DT_TM or 
    ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Ordered' or
    ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Discontinued' and DISCONTINUE_EFFECTIVE_DT_TM > x.DISCH_DT_TM or 
    ORDER_STATUS_CD = 'Deleted' and STATUS_DT_TM > x.DISCH_DT_TM)
   LEFT JOIN MEDICATION_LIST as z
    on CATALOG_CD = MEDICATION_NAME
    left join MEDICATION_GROUP as q
    on z.MEDICATION_GROUP_ID = q.MEDICATION_GROUP_ID
  where y.ORIG_ORD_AS_FLAG =  1 and x.ENCNTR_ID in (",paste(primary_enc$ENCNTR_ID,collapse=","),") and q.MEDICATION_GROUP is not NULL;")
prescribe_meds <- execute_query(prescribed_meds_query)
med_group <- load_db("medication_group")

# 84432221
# 84002906
# 89084556
# 84344812 has ACE discontinued 1 day after discharge
# 84451934 
# 94466534
# 90274372
# 94443909
# 98084016
discharge_med_summary <- as.tibble(discharge_meds, .name_repair = "universal") %>% 
  dplyr::bind_rows(as.tibble(prescribe_meds, .name_repair = "universal")) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(IS_DISCHARGE = TRUE) %>%
  dplyr::select(ENCNTR_ID...2,MEDICATION_GROUP,IS_DISCHARGE) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ENCNTR_ID...2) %>%
  tidyr::pivot_wider(id_cols = ENCNTR_ID...2,
                     names_from = MEDICATION_GROUP,
                     values_from = IS_DISCHARGE, 
                     values_fn = any,
                     values_fill = FALSE) %>%
  dplyr::rename(ENCNTR_ID = ENCNTR_ID...2) %>% 
  dplyr::ungroup()

missing_col <- setdiff(med_group$MEDICATION_GROUP,colnames(discharge_med_summary))
discharge_med_summary[missing_col] <- FALSE


discharge_med_summary %<>%
 dplyr::right_join(select(primary_enc,ENCNTR_ID), by = "ENCNTR_ID") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    across(everything(), ~replace_na(.x, FALSE))
  )
plot_logical_columns(discharge_med_summary, "MEDICATION",title = "Discharge Medications",n_suffix = "encounters",vjust = 0.25) +
  coord_flip()

primary_cohort <- cohort %>%
  dplyr::filter(PERSON_ID %in% qual_enc$PERSON_ID) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_PRIMARY_HF = TRUE)


AGE_breaks <- c(-Inf,18, 25, 45, 65, 80, Inf)
  AGE_labels <- c("<18", "19-24", "25-44", "45-64", "65-80", "80+")
  
primary_enc <- qual_enc %>%
  dplyr::left_join(patient, by = "PERSON_ID") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(AGE = as.integer(difftime(ACTIVE_STATUS_DT_TM,BIRTH_DT_TM, units="weeks")/52.25)) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(AGE_BINNED = cut(AGE, breaks = AGE_breaks, labels = AGE_labels,
                                   right = FALSE)) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(LOS = difftime(DISCH_DT_TM,ARRIVE_DT_TM,units="days"))
total<- bind_rows(primary_enc, mutate(primary_enc, SEX_CD = "Total")) %>%
  group_by(SEX_CD) %>%
  summarise(
    N = n(),
    Age = round(mean(AGE)),
  ) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = "SEX_CD", values_from = c("N", "Age")) %>%
  mutate(p_Female = round(N_Female/N_Total*100, 1),
         p_Male = round(N_Male/N_Total*100, 1)) %>%
  select(
         Females = N_Female, p_Female,
         Males = N_Male, p_Male,
         N_Total,
         Age_Female,
         Age_Male,
         Age_Total) %>%
  flextable() %>%
  set_header_labels(Group = "", p_Female = "%", p_Male = "%", N_Total = "n",
                    Age_Female = "Age (F)", Age_Male = "Age (M)", Age_Total = "Mean Age")
total

Historical Diagnosis

his_hf_diag <- diagnosis_history %>%
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(SOURCE_IDENTIFIER,"(?i)I50") &
                  PERSON_ID %in% primary_cohort$PERSON_ID)

summary_his_diag <- his_hf_diag %>%
  extract_hf_diagnosis(group_cols = "PERSON_ID") %>%
  dplyr::right_join(primary_cohort,by="PERSON_ID") %>%
  dplyr::select(-HAS_PRIMARY_HF) %>%
  replace(is.na(.),FALSE) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(`No His. HF ICD10` = !`Congestive heart failure` & !`Heart failure, unspecified`
                  & !`Left ventricular failure`)
plot_logical_columns(summary_his_diag,"ICD10","Distribution of Historical ICD10")

Distribution of historical diagnosis.

Orders

echos <- orders %>%
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(CATALOG_CD,"(?i)cardio - echo") & ENCNTR_ID %in% primary_enc$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(STATUS_DT_TM)) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
  dplyr::select(ENCNTR_ID,CATALOG_CD,STATUS_DT_TM) %>%
  dplyr::right_join(
    dplyr::select(primary_enc,ENCNTR_ID,ARRIVE_DT_TM),by="ENCNTR_ID") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_ECHO = !is.na(CATALOG_CD),ECHO_DELTA = difftime(STATUS_DT_TM,ARRIVE_DT_TM,units = "days")) %>%
  dplyr::ungroup() %>%
  dplyr::select(-CATALOG_CD) %>%
  dplyr::rename(ECHO_START_DT_TM = STATUS_DT_TM)
path_tests <- execute_query("SELECT * from PATHOLOGY_EVENT where CATALOG_CD = 'Brain Natriuretic Peptide' or CATALOG_CD = 'Iron Level' or CATALOG_CD = 'Iron Studies' or CATALOG_CD = 'N Terminal Pro Brain Natriuretic Peptide'")

path_tests %<>%
  dplyr::filter(ENCNTR_ID %in% primary_enc$ENCNTR_ID) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(EVENT_CD = dplyr::case_when(
    stringr::str_detect(EVENT_CD,"(Brain Natriuretic peptide)|(N Terminal pro BNP)|(NT-ProBNP)") ~ "BNP",
    TRUE ~ EVENT_CD
  )) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(ENCNTR_ID,EVENT_CD) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(desc(EVENT_START_DT_TM)) %>%
  dplyr::slice(1) %>%
  dplyr::ungroup()
hf_order<-echos  %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    extract_path_result(path_tests,"BNP", "BNP", c(-Inf,450,900,Inf),c("< 450","450-900","900+")), by="ENCNTR_ID"
  ) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    extract_path_result(path_tests,"Iron", "IRON",c(-Inf,9,30.4,Inf),c("< 9","9-30.4","30.4+")), by="ENCNTR_ID"
  ) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    extract_path_result(path_tests,"Transferrin Saturation", "TRANSFERRIN_SAT",c(-Inf,20,Inf),c("< 20","20+")), by="ENCNTR_ID"
  ) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(HAS_BNP = !is.na(BNP_EVENT_START_DT_TM),
                HAS_IRON = !is.na(IRON_EVENT_START_DT_TM),
                HAS_TRANSFERRIN_SAT = !is.na(TRANSFERRIN_SAT_EVENT_START_DT_TM))

plot_logical_columns(hf_order,"ORDERS","Proportion of Encounter with Order")

Number and proportion of Encounters with a relevant heart failure order, echocardiogram, brain natriuretic peptide test, serum iron test and transferrin saturation test. 

mean_delta <- mean(hf_order$ECHO_DELTA,na.rm = TRUE)
plot_histogram(hf_order %>% dplyr::filter(ECHO_DELTA < 75),
               "ECHO_DELTA","Distribution of time taken for Echo",
               mean_delta) + 
    xlab("Time take for echo since admission (days)")

Distribution of the time taken for an echocardiogram.

Figure @ref(fig:order-prop-plot) shows the proportion of encounters with a relevant heart failure order being echocardiogram, brain natriuretic peptide test, serum iron test and transferrin saturation test. Furthermore Figure @ref(fig:echo-time-plot) shows the distribution of the time taken for an echocardiogram with a mean time of 5.2 days.

p1<-plot_pie_chart(hf_order,"BNP_BIN","BNP Results by Group")
p2<-plot_pie_chart(hf_order,"IRON_BIN","BNP Results by Group")
p3<-plot_pie_chart(hf_order,"TRANSFERRIN_SAT_BIN","BNP Results by Group")

Results of pathology tests.

Forms

form_primary_cohort <- primary_cohort %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    extract_form(hf_form,'Heart Failure - Management of Cardiac Function Enrolment',"ENROLMENT"), by = c("PERSON_ID" = "ENROLMENT_PERSON_ID")
  ) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    extract_form(hf_form,'Heart Failure (MACARF) Referral Form',"REFERRAL"), by = c("PERSON_ID" = "REFERRAL_PERSON_ID")
  ) %>%
  tidyr::replace_na(list(ENROLMENT_HAS_FORM = FALSE, REFERRAL_HAS_FORM = FALSE))

plot_logical_columns(form_primary_cohort %>% dplyr::select(-HAS_PRIMARY_HF),"Form","Proportion with HF Form")

Proportion of Patients with an enrolment or referral form.
